subject: Re: [junit] Re: ClassDefNotFound Errors
msgSnippet: ... There might be something missing from your classpath when you run the tests from the command line using Ant, that you have correctly configured with
messageBody:
Angela Day wrote:
>
>
> John,
> Sorry for the confusing. No, I am using the Run as -> JUnit Test
> from within JUnit. When I do run the tests from the command line,
> thought, they fail with errors.

There might be something missing from your classpath when you run the
tests from the command line using Ant, that you have correctly
configured with Eclipse. Make sure you have corresponding entries in
your Ant <classpath> element to the ones in your Eclipse Java Build Path.

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
